title: Bug 49299 - Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting
description: Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 mentions that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (given that URL rewriting has been enabled). However, in the actual result, the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' but the 'Reload' link on the page uses 'jsessionid' instead.
OB: In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that a custom cookie name for session tracking affects URL rewriting. However, in this scenario, the custom cookie name is not being used for URL rewriting.
EB: The expected behavior is that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name should be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session ID is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled).
SR: To reproduce this issue: 1. Deploy the attached war file 'cookiename.war'. 2. Access 'http://localhost:8080/cookiename/'.
